Annotation.String: Instrument type codes (e.g., CMO/ABS, Equities, Gov/Corp, US Municipals).
Code indicating the instrument's security classification type. Replaced by Thomson Reuters Classification Scheme. (GCODES link: Asset Category Codes)
Issuer's abbreviated name.
Currency code for the trading instrument. (GCODES link: Currency Codes)
Instrument description; Format varies by instrument type.
ISO code representing the current country of the company's principal executive offices. (GCODES link: Country Codes)
Y/N/Either flag indicating whether the instrument includes fair value information.
Exchange code identifying where the instrument trades. (GCODES link: Exchange Codes)
Global Industry Classification Standard code for the sub-industry level.
Internal product code used to define a group of instruments.
Unique number that identifies a company in Thomson Reuters database.
Code representing the status of the instrument.

Code assigned by an exchange or issuer for identification of their security. For Futures and Options, it is the series or product-level code provided by the exchange and is the same for all expiries or strikes on that series. For Montreal and OPRA, it is the contract-level exchange feed symbol as defined by the local market convention.
Code representing the asset sub classification within the security type code. (GCODES link: Asset Sub Type Codes)
Identifies the option being exercised as a put or call option.
Internal product code used to define a group of instruments.
Equity exchange quotation (not used for options on NASDAQ equities).
Code indicating when the option can be exercised.
Currency code for the trading instrument. (GCODES link: Currency Codes)
Instrument description; Format varies by instrument type.
Exchange code identifying where the instrument trades. (GCODES link: Exchange Codes)
Price at which the holder agrees to buy or sell the underlying futures contract on or before the option expiration date.
Date on which a futures or an options contract automatically expires.
Code representing the status of the instrument.
Instrument description; Format varies by instrument type.
Code representing the status of the instrument.
Code representing the instrument's pricing source. (GCODES link: Price Source Codes)
ISO country code for the instrument. (GCODES link: Country Codes)
Stated annual interest rate for a bond, note, or other fixed income instrument, expressed as a percentage of face value.
Currency code for the trading instrument. (GCODES link: Currency Codes)
Code identifying the industry of the issuer. (GCODES link: Industry Sector Codes)
Code representing the asset sub classification within the security type code. (GCODES link: Asset Sub Type Codes)
Current Moody's published or announced rating for the asset. (GCODES link: Rating Codes)
Standard and Poor's current published or announced rating. (GCODES link: Rating Codes)
Y/N flag indicating whether the bond is callable.
Y/N flag indicating whether the security may be exchanged or converted into another type of security from the issuer (for example, common stock).
Y/N flag indicating whether there is a provision to extend the maturity date.
Y/N flag indicating whether the bond is putable.
Y/N flag indicating whether the bond has a sinking fund provision.
Long name of the company.
Asset's issuance date.
Instrument's maturity date.
Date the next coupon payment will be made.
Unique number that identifies a company in Thomson Reuters database.

Code assigned by an exchange or issuer for identification of their security. For Futures and Options, it is the series or product-level code provided by the exchange and is the same for all expiries or strikes on that series. For Montreal and OPRA, it is the contract-level exchange feed symbol as defined by the local market convention.
Long name of the company.

Enter all or part of the entity's name. Select Official Name Only to restrict your search to the entity's official name. If you do not select this option, the search will be expanded to include trading name(s) by which the entity is known in the market place.
Legal Entity's official/legal name.

Use Official Name Only to restrict your search to the entity's official name. If you do not select this option, the search will be expanded to include trading name(s) by which the entity is known in the market place.
ISO code representing the current country of the company's principal executive offices. (GCODES link: Country Codes)

Select one or more countries in which the entity is based. This location can differ from the entity's country of incorporation for entities registered in offshore locations or entities that operate in multiple locations. Use CountryOfIncorporationCodes to select the country in which the entity is incorporated.
Code indicating the ISO country in which the legal entity is incorporated. (GCODES link: Country Codes)
Code indicating the instrument's classification within the business sector level (second level in the four-level hierarchy) as defined by TRBC.
Select the Thomson Reuters Business Code for the business of the entity.
Indicates that the entity was manually verified, with minimum required fields updated from approved sources.
Set to true to return only verified records in the search results.
Y/N flag indicating whether the legal entity is regulated.
Select to constrain your search to return regulated legal entities only. When cleared, both regulated and non-regulated legal entities are returned.
Y/N flag indicating whether the legal entity is an issuer of securities.
Y/N flag indicating whether the legal entity is active. Flag is triggered based on whether the legal entity is obsolete.
Code representing the status of the instrument.
Instrument description; Format varies by instrument type.
Name of the company administering the fund.
Company that has the day-to-day responsibility for investing and monitoring the assets within the fund's portfolio.
ISO code representing the current country of the company's principal executive offices. (GCODES link: Country Codes)
Currency code for the trading instrument. (GCODES link: Currency Codes)
Code representing the asset sub classification within the security type code. (GCODES link: Asset Sub Type Codes)
Searches multiple fields for a value.
The fields searched are identifier, description, long description, file code, and lot units.
Code representing the status of the instrument.
Month and year of delivery that uniquely identifies the futures contract at the exchange, formatted as 'MMMYYYY'. Currently, not available for all futures.
Instrument description; Format varies by instrument type.
Date on which a futures or an options contract automatically expires.
Primary Chain is the immediate chain under which a RIC is listed.
Codes indicating the instrument's security classification type. Replaced by Thomson Reuters Classification Scheme. (GCODES link: Asset Category Codes).
This operator controls the selection by Asset Category. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by AssetCategoryCodes.
Currency codes for the trading instrument. (GCODES link: Currency Codes)
This operator controls the selection by Currency Code. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by CurrencyCodes.
Exchange codes identifying where the instrument trades. (GCODES link: Exchange Codes)
This operator controls the selection by Exchange Code. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by ExchangeCodes.
Internal product code used to define a group of instruments.
This operator controls the selection by File Code. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by FileCodes.
Indicators of how often pricing for the instrument updates.
This operator controls the selection by Frequency of Update. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by FrequenciesOfUpdate.
Defines the physical units in which a contract trades.
This operator controls the selection by Lot Unit. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by LotUnits.
Product or natural resource underlying a specific asset.
This operator controls the selection by Underlying Product. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by FrequenciesOfUpdate.
Full-length description of the source of the data.
This operator controls the selection by Source Name. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by SourceNames.
Label for the type of institution that is populated in Source Name field.
This operator controls the selection by Source Type. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by SourceTypes.
Codes indicating the instrument's asset classification scheme as provided by Thomson Reuters.
This operator controls the selection by Classification Scheme. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by TrClassificationSchemes.
Product underlying the instrument.
This operator controls the selection by Underlying Asset. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by CommoditiesUnderlyingAssets.
PDP codes to identify exchanges and other data sources.
This operator controls the selection by PDP Code. The operator causes searches to include or exclude data that contains the values enumerated by PdpCodes.
Describes search parameters provided to the Commodities Search Service.
String search terms are case-sensitive, and match the exact phrase. For those fields that are enumerable, the search terms are a logical 'OR'. Search terms on multiple fields are a logical 'AND'.
Code indicating the issuing agency of the MBS. (GCODES link: Agency Codes)
Actual loan number (for loan-level collateral) or synthetic pool number (for an aggregation of loans).
Actual loan number (for loan-level collateral) or synthetic pool number (for an aggregation of loans).
Code indicating the classification scheme for pools.
Stated annual interest rate for a bond, note, or other fixed income instrument, expressed as a percentage of face value.

The Coupon can be either a NumericValueComparison or NumericRangeComparison. The NumericValueComparison allows you to limit the search results to those greater than, greater than or equal to, less than, less than or equal to or equal to a certain rate. The NumericRangeComparison allows you to limit the search results to coupon rates within the specified range.
Code representing the scheduled mortgage principal amortization method.
Code representing the status of the instrument.
Code representing the asset sub classification within the security type code. (GCODES link: Asset Sub Type Codes)
Code representing the settlement month for a TBA asset.
Search criteria for Mortgage Pass Through securities.
Code representing the status of the instrument.
Stated annual interest rate for a bond, note, or other fixed income instrument, expressed as a percentage of face value.

The Coupon can be either a NumericValueComparison or NumericRangeComparison. The NumericValueComparison allows you to limit the search results to those greater than, greater than or equal to, less than, less than or equal to or equal to a certain rate. The NumericRangeComparison allows you to limit the search results to coupon rates within the specified range.
Y/N flag indicating whether the bond is callable.
Callable or redeemable bonds are bonds that can be redeemed or paid off by the issuer prior to the bonds' maturity date.
Y/N flag indicating whether the bond is putable.

A putable bond (put bond, putable or retractable bond) is a bond with an embedded put option. The holder of the putable bond as the right, but not the obligation, to demand early repayment of the principal.
Y/N flag indicating whether the bond has a sinking fund provision.
Sinking Fund Redemption requires the issuer to regularly redeem a fixed portion or all of the bonds in accordance with a fixed schedule.
Long name of the company.
Instrument's maturity date.

The MaturityDate can be either a DateValueComparison or DateRangeComparison. The DateValueComparison allows you to limit the search results to those greater than, greater than or equal to, less than, less than or equal to or equal to a certain rate. The DateRangeComparison allows you to limit the search results to maturity dates within the specified range.
Current Moody's published or announced rating for the asset. (GCODES link: Rating Codes)
Standard and Poor's current published or announced rating. (GCODES link: Rating Codes)
Code identifying the state where the party's principal executive offices are located. (GCODES link: State Codes)
Search criteria for US Municipal bonds.
Code representing the asset sub classification within the security type code. (GCODES link: Asset Sub Type Codes)
Unique short name to identify the issuer.
Unique name to identify the tranche within a deal.
Unique name used to identify the deal from the issuer.
Stated annual interest rate for a bond, note, or other fixed income instrument, expressed as a percentage of face value.
Code representing the status of the instrument.
Currency code for the trading instrument. (GCODES link: Currency Codes)
Search criteria for collateralized mortgage obligations and asset backed securities
Searches multiple fields for a value.
The fields searched are identifier.
Describes search parameters provided to the MiFID Sub-Class Search Service.
String search terms are case-sensitive, and match the exact phrase. For those fields that are enumerable, the search terms are a logical 'OR'. Search terms on multiple fields are a logical 'AND'.
The identification system (e.g., CUSIP, ISIN, RIC) used to uniquely identify a company or issuer, and type of security. The only valid value for OTCS Search at the moment is ISIN
Unique alphanumeric code that corresponds to the Identifier Types.
Code representing the status of the instrument.
Describes search parameters provided to the OTCS Limited Terms Search Service.
String search terms are case-sensitive, and match the exact phrase. For those fields that are enumerable, the search terms are a logical 'OR'. Search terms on multiple fields are a logical 'AND'.
Instrument identifier of HistoricalSearchRequest.IdentifierType.
The Identifier Type of the HistoricalSearchRequest.Identifier. Supported Types are RIC, CUSIP, ISIN, SEDOL. Optional: Search will look for the identifier in all supported types when not specified.
The Date range in which the instrument was active. If the instrument exists, but was not active in the specified date range, it will not be returned.

Determines what information is returned for each found RIC. By RIC: Returns information purely based on the RIC history. By Entity: Returns information based on the entity associated with the RIC on the end date of the Range. This will cause RIC rename history to be returned. Optional: Defaults to searching by RIC when not specified.
Limit search results to the specified Eikon Domain(s).
Request to search for historical instruments by identifier.
Instrument identifiers for the search.
Specifies the date range to include for the search.
Specifies how the results will be gathered.
Request to search for multiple historical instruments by identifier.
Search for RIC identifiers that match the specified regular expression.
Search for instrument descriptions that match the specified regular expression.
Search by Bond Type. Applies to Fixed Income only.
Search by Contributor. Applies to OTC instruments only.
Search by Country RIC Prefix Applies to Fixed Income only.
Search by Currency.
Limit search results to the specified Eikon Domain(s).
Search by Exchange.
Search by Future Delivery Month. Applies to Futures only.
Search by Instrument Type.
Search by Expiry Month. Applies to Fixed Income only.
Search by Option Type. Applies to Options only.
Search by Coupon Rate. Applies to Fixed Income only.
Search by Strike Price. Applies to Options only.
Search by Expiry Date range. Applies to Futures and Options only.
Search by Maturity Date range. Applies to Fixed Income only.
The Date range in which the instrument was active. If the instrument exists, but was not active in the specified date range, it will not be returned.

Determines what information is returned for each found RIC. By RIC: Returns information purely based on the found RICs history. By Entity: Returns information based on the entity associated with the RIC on the end date of the Range. This will cause RIC rename history to be returned. Optional: Defaults to searching by RIC.
Request to search for historical instruments by criteria.
List of Chain RICs to return constituents for.
The Date range in which constituents are members of the chain. A constituent will be returned if it was a member for any part of the date range.
Request to resolve a chain's historical constituents.
The RIC identifiers to return reference history for.
The Date range to return reference history changes from.

Determines what reference history is returned for each RIC. By RIC: Returns reference history for the RICs specified. By Entity: Returns reference history based on the entity associated with the RIC on the end date of the Range. This will causes reference history from multiple RICs to be merged into one list if there was a RIC rename during the date range specified. Optional: Defaults to 'By RIC' when not specified.
Request to lookup reference history be RICs and a date/time range.
Search criteria
Search criteria
Search criteria
Identifier based search request
Criteria based search request
Chain resolution request.
Request by RIC
Search for one or more instruments by instrument type.

Search for equities (common, preferred, etc.), indices, exchange warrants, equity options, open funds, etc. Note, the paging skip token does not work. The search will return 500 results (page size) by default. If your result set is larger than this, you can increase the page size in the request or narrow your search criteria.
Search for futures and options and options on futures.
Search for benchmark instruments
Search for government/corporate instruments.
Search for a public or private legal entity, including issuers of debt and equity instruments.
Search for fund-level and fund shares class data.
Search for commodities.
Search for mortgage backed securities.
Search for US municipal bonds.
Search for collateralized mortgage obligations and asset backed securities.
Search for MiFID Sub-Classes.
Search for OTCS Instruments.
Search for historical instruments given an instrument identifier.
Return instruments may be currently active, or inactive 'historical only' instruments.
Search for historical instruments given a list of instrument identifiers.
Search for historical instruments given search criteria. Instruments may be currently active, or inactive 'historical only' instruments.
Resolve current and past chain constituents given a Chain RIC. Instruments may be currently active, or inactive 'historical only' instruments.
Retrieve FID reference history events for a set of RICs in a specified date range.
Returns a list of Bond Type Codes and Names. This includes present and past entries. Applies to Fixed Income only.
Returns a list of Country RIC Prefix Codes and Names. This includes present and past entries. Applies to Fixed Income only.
Returns a list of Currency Codes and Names. This includes present and past entries.
Returns a list of Eikon Domain Codes and Names. This includes present and past entries.
Returns a list of Exchange Codes and Names. This includes present and past entries.
Returns a list of Future Delivery Month Codes and Names. Applies to Futures only.
Returns a list of Instrument Type Codes and Names. This includes present and past entries.
Returns a list of Option Type Codes and Names. This includes present and past entries. Applies to Options only.
Returns a list of Expiry Month Codes and Names. Applies to Fixed Income only.
Returns the list of Global Industry Classification Standard (GICS) industry classifications.
Returns the list of exchange codes and their descriptions (e.g., Shanghai Stock Exchange (SHH)).
Returns the list of country codes and their descriptions.
Returns the list of US state codes and their descriptions (e.g., Minnesota).
Returns the list of currency codes, ISO codes and their descriptions (e.g., U.S. Dollar, Swiss Franc).
Returns the list of file codes.
Returns the Thomson Reuters business classification codes.
Returns the list of Gov/Corp contributor names and codes.
Returns the list of industry sectors (e.g., Agency, Banks, Consumer Goods).
Returns a list of equity sub-types (e.g., Convertible Preference, Depository Receipts, Financial Index, etc.).
Returns the Moody's ratings codes and descriptions (e.g., NR, Aaa, #Aaa).
Returns the Standard and Poor's (SandP) ratings codes and descriptions (e.g., AAA, AA+).
Returns the list of mortgage agency codes and descriptions (e.g., Fannie Mae).
Returns the list of mortgage pool type codes and descriptions (e.g., FH 15yr COOP nonGLD).
Returns sub groups for CMOs and ABS used for CmoAbsSearch.
Returns the list of asset categories.
Returns the list of sub groups for instruments used for InstrumentSearch.
Returns the list of Gov/Corp asset statuses.
